page.title: 06LLISWERRY HIGH, NEWPORT.
page.content: {Lliswerry High School}was first opened in November 1974 and attracted a large number of pupils. The first headmaster was Dr.John Herbert, who retired in December 1984. An art block,a music suite and a sixth form block were added to the original buildings as the school developed until there were seven years in the school. Then a leisure centre was added which extended the sports facilities for the school. The school regularly has winners at the{National Urdd Eisteddfod,}being the only school in Newport where{Welsh is studied. Pupils have represented Wales and Great Britain in Sports teams. Pupils have left school to attend many Universities. A team of staff and pupils ran a relay from John O'Groats to Lands End to raise money for the Ethiopian Appeal.
